Detailed Description

This class is used to store a packed x and z coordinate.

Member Function Documentation

void PackedXZ::getXZError ( float &  xError,
float &  zError 
) const [inline]

This method returns the maximum error in the x and z components caused by compression.

void PackedXZ::packXZ ( float  xValue,
float  zValue 
) [inline]

This function compresses the two input floats into the low 3 bytes of the return value.

It does this as follows:

Bits 12-23 can be thought of as a 12-bit float storing the x-value. Bits 0-11 can be thought of as a 12-bit float storing the z-value. Bits 0-7 are the mantissa, bits 8-10 are the unsigned exponent and bit 11 is the sign bit.

The input values must be in the range (-510, 510).

void PackedXZ::unpackXZ ( float &  x,
float &  z 
) const [inline]

This function uncompresses the values that were created by pack.
